intro: Pseudocannaboides andringitrensis, commonly known as the Andringa pseudocannaboides, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
